result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Bruckner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 14-CM-42, 14-CF-31 & 14-CF-69. Probation agent to contact the Court to set probation review hearing about 60-90 days after defendant is done serving jail sentence.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

No contact with victims and co-defendants, C.M., B.V., B.V., M.W., T.S.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Letters from DAI staff to Court regarding sentencing credit.         Laurie: Amend JOC and give 99 days of credit in both files. DTE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from ADA Korb to court regarding sentence credit calculations.

from Sarah Feltes of Fox Lake Correction Inst. requesting clarification of sentence credit regarding 4 cases for defendant. Court grants 94 days credit for file 14-CF-61, 94 days credit for file 14-CF-69, 72 days credit for file 15-CM-48 and 72 days credit for file 15-CM-167.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin.  Bond is no longer in effect.
Change of Attorney

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State would like to resolve all 7 pending files globally.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:30 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 5/6/14.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Elisabeth Stockbridge.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case will track 14-CF-69. State requests new bonds be set based on motions to forfeit that have been filed. Court advises that process to forfeit has started. Defense questions if motion will be heard at prelim.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Information will be filed this afternoon. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek. Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
by Ayashe Gerdeen
No contact direct or indirect with CM. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner appeared by video conference. Attorney Eric S Maciolek appeared by phone. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/12/14, 10:00.
